availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jeremiah C. Wilkins (Warren County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Jane A. Milliken Wilkins. Father of Elizabeth H. Wilkins, James Wilkins, Mary B. Wilkins Burnam, Frances A. Wilkins Brown, John M. Wilkins, William T. Wilkins, and Anna M. Wilkins. Resident of Warren County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Warren County in 1840. Attorney in Warren County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Owned at least two enslaved persons, including Winney, in Warren County in 1854. Attorney in Warren County in 1860. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860.
